channel.title: Html clicking

item.title: Html clicking
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Davidi2:

I didn’t see you post an opinion? I was explaining from past experience what happens (I used to use notepad too). Unless you’re saying you find un-indented code easier to read for you, which is completely fine.

I’ve been trying to say that, but i figured it out so no problems anymore

Read full topic

item.title: Html clicking
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The point is, using good indentation (and other readability practices), can make it easier for YOU to develop as well, not just other people. Especially if you’re not using a development environment (which you probably should be), readable code can be vital.

Read full topic

item.title: Html clicking
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:12, topic:427596”][quote author=runescape sucks link=topic=530296.msg3872689#msg3872689 date=1325460782]

I indented mine properly. It certainly increased readability.

I can read mine… It’s my file, my friend is going to play it.

I’m not going to release this or anything.
[/quote]

Then you will always seem incompetent to other web developers.[/quote]
This is pretty much the only thing i have ever tried to develop.

Read full topic

item.description:

Nice indentation…
[/quote]
It’s not like anyone else is going to be using it to write something…[/quote]
you’re asking for help with a snippet. indenting properly makes it easier for others to read your code; don’t be lazy.

item.title: Html clicking
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

<html>
    <head>
        <script type="text/javascript">
            function sell() {
                // do stuff here
            }
        </script>
    </head>
    <body>
        <input type="button" onClick="sell();" value="Sell Ore" />
    </body>
</html>

Source: http://www.w3schools.com/js/default.asp

Read full topic

item.title: Html clicking
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

Well, I’m making a “mining” game for my friend, and i’m trying to add in money to it, but it does not seem to sell the ores, or give the player the money.

[code=html]

[/code]

This is my first time ever making a “clicking” button on html, but i have no idea what to do.

Read full topic
